p: The bean weevil, Acanthoscelides obtectus Say (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Bruchinae), is a pest that thrives primarily in stored common beans, Phaseolus vulgaris L. (wild and cultivated) [ 1, 2, 3]. A. obtectus attacks P. vulgaris seeds while they are still in the field, and the damage continues during storage, where it causes the greatest losses [ 4]. According to [ 5], when not treated, A. obtectus population grows exponentially causing the loss of whole crops within a few months.
